summary: This document is an email correspondence from the FBI's FOIA system, containing a FOIA request submitted on December 6, 2018. The requester seeks records related to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically from 2006-2010, including communications, evidence, and any documents that might show interference in his investigation or prosecution. The requester argues for expedited processing and a fee waiver, citing significant public interest in Epstein's connections to politicians and royalty.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Convicted sex offender, subject of FOIA request
persons.context: The FOIA request is specifically for records related to him, his investigation, and his co-conspirators between 2006 and 2010.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned by the requester as an example of Epstein's connections to politicians and heads of state, which is cited as a reason for significant public interest in the records.

connections.description: The requester references Epstein's reported ties to former and current agents, royals, and politicians, specifically naming Prince Andrew as an example.

events.title: Period of requested FBI records
events.description: The FOIA requester is specifically seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators from roughly 2006 to 2010.

events.title: FOIA Request Submission
events.description: An individual submits a FOIA request to the FBI for records on Jeffrey Epstein, requesting expedited processing and a fee waiver.

keyFacts: A FOIA request was submitted to the FBI in December 2018 seeking all records related to Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators from approximately 2006 to 2010.
The requester specifically asks for communications, evidence (photos/videos), and any documents that might show instructions to hinder the investigation or prosecution of Epstein.
The requester argues for expedited processing and a fee waiver, citing the significant public interest in Epstein's case and his connections to figures like Prince Andrew.
The document is an automated system email acknowledging receipt of the FOIA request, indicating it was in a pending status as of December 2018.
